text:
How come there is not a command to easily delete the big growing access log files?

To restart my server I type "sudo /etc/init.d/apache2 restart" I think there should be an identical command for resetting/deleting the log files, something like "sudo /etc/init.d/apache2 resetlog" or "sudo /etc/init.d/apache2 restart -resetlog"
